@autumnbreezed And as that article states, Ireland has never been part of Britain. We were part of the UK (“the United Kingdoms of Great Britain and Ireland”) until 1922. After this point the official definition of the UK changed to insert the word Northern in front of Ireland. Voilà! :)

@autumnbreezed The geographical term is correct, it’s just a charged term in Ireland because of the connotations of possession. There’s a lot of history/conflict involved. Some context: https://t.co/X4eySD8C5F

@autumnbreezed Yep, you are correct, just Northern Ireland. UK and Ireland works. It’s not a big deal to be honest. It’s probably the same as Canadian people being grouped in as American. :)
